metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1254 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Tor before 0.2.8.12 might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (client crash) via a crafted hidden service descriptor. It was discovered that the Tor client could be made to crash via a crafted hidden service descriptor. This could result in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1254` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tor - 0.2.9.14-1ubuntu1~16.04.2
tor-geoipdb - 0.2.9.14-1ubuntu1~16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tor package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.9.14-1ubuntu1~16.04.2').
